snippet: The OSI Group, one of the top meat producers in the United States with more than $6 billion in sales and about 20,000 employees in 17 countries, is enveloped in a food safety scandal in China.
abstract: OSI Group, one of top meat producers in the United States, has become enveloped in a food safety scandal in China; stands accused of doctoring labels to extend expiration dates on chicken and beef products, among other lapses; situation is rare black mark for OSI, one of America's top meat producers, and speaks to broader weaknesses in China's food safety system.
lead_paragraph: The OSI Group, one of the top meat producers in the United States with more than $6 billion in sales and about 20,000 employees in 17 countries, is enveloped in a food safety scandal in China.

headline.main: Weak Links in China’s Food Chain
headline.print_headline: Weak Links in China’s Food Chain
